kickstart.post:
#%PAM-1.0 #auth include password-auth #account required pam_nologin.so #account include password-auth #password include password-auth #session include password-auth
auth required pam_google_authenticator.so forward_pass account required pam_unix.so use_first_pass
# make radius run as root # we need this to read user password /bin/sed -i 's/user =.*/user = root/g' /etc/raddb/radiusd.conf /bin/sed -i 's/group =.*/group = root/g' /etc/raddb/radiusd.conf
# fix folder permission since we run as root /bin/chown root:root /var/run/radiusd
# Enable PAM login for users with group radiususers # make adminstrative login for switchadmin group # make basic login for switchlogin group
DEFAULT Group == "disabled", Auth-Type := Reject Reply-Message = "Your account has been disabled."
DEFAULT Group == "switchadmin" Service-Type = Administrative-User, Fall-Through = Yes
DEFAULT Group == "switchlogin" Service-Type = Login-User, Fall-Through = Yes
DEFAULT Group == "radiususers", Auth-Type := PAM
# fix site-enable to use pam for authentication rm /etc/raddb/sites-enabled/default
sed -e 's/#\tpam/pam/' /etc/raddb/sites-available/default
# turn on the server at boot time /sbin/chkconfig radiusd on
# create our groups /usr/sbin/groupadd switchadmin /usr/sbin/groupadd switchlogin /usr/sbin/groupadd radiususers
# disable raidususers from all login /bin/echo -e "# rocks\nauth required pam_listfile.so onerr=fail item=group sense=deny file=/etc/login.group.deny\n" \ | /bin/cat - /etc/pam.d/password-auth-ac > /tmp/password-auth-temp-file /bin/mv /tmp/password-auth-temp-file /etc/system-auth-ac echo radiususers > /etc/login.group.deny
